en: Hear my prayer, O Jehovah, And let my cry come unto thee.
hmr: Aw LALPA, ka ṭawngṭâina hi lo ngai la, Ka khêkri hi i kuom tlung raw se.

en: Hide not thy face from me in the day of my distress: Incline thine ear unto me; In the day when I call answer me speedily.
hmr: Ka lunginzîng ni chun keia kuomah i hmai thup naw la, Keia tieng hin i na hung sit la, Ka ko pha che chun mi hung dawn vak rawh.

en: For my days consume away like smoke, And my bones are burned as a firebrand.
hmr: Ka dam sûng nihai hi meikhu angin ân zâm hmang a, Ka ruhai hi thingthu angin a sah a,

en: My heart is smitten like grass, and withered; For I forget to eat my bread.
hmr: Ka lungril hi hlobet anga em hlumin a um a, a vuoi zo tah: Bu fâk khawm ka theinghil sih a.

en: By reason of the voice of my groaning My bones cleave to my flesh.
hmr: Kân rûm rîk leiin, Ka ruhai hi ka tisaah a kawp tlat a nih.

en: I am like a pelican of the wilderness; I am become as an owl of the waste places.
hmr: Thlalêr tuivalawng ang ka na, Khaw hmun hlui simbuk ang el ka lo ni tah a.

en: I watch, and am become like a sparrow That is alone upon the house-top.
hmr: Ka meng zing a, Chawngzawng a khât chaua in chunga um ang ka lo ni tah a.

en: Mine enemies reproach me all the day; They that are mad against me do curse by me.
hmr: A mi dotuhai chun sûnnithlâkin an mi hrilsiet hlak a, Ka chunga ṭiumhai chun vânnikhâmnain an mi hmang a.

en: For I have eaten ashes like bread, And mingled my drink with weeping,
hmr: Vut hi bu angin ka fâk a, Ka dâwn ding chu mitthli leh ka pawl ta sih a.

en: Because of thine indignation and thy wrath: For thou hast taken me up, and cast me away.
hmr: I lungninaw êm êm le i lunginsen leiin, Nangin i mi lâk kâng a, i mi pei ta sih a.

en: My days are like a shadow that declineth; And I am withered like grass.
hmr: Ka dam sûng nihai hi hlim bo tieng intung ta ang a na, Hlobet angin ka vuoi tah a.

en: But thou, O Jehovah, wilt abide for ever; And thy memorial name unto all generations.
hmr: Aw LALPA, nang ruok chu kumkhawtluongin um i ta, Nangma hriet zingna khawm suon po po chenin um bawk a tih.

en: Thou wilt arise, and have mercy upon Zion; For it is time to have pity upon her, Yea, the set time is come.
hmr: Tho i ta, Zion tlâng chu lunginsiet i tih, Ama chu lunginsiet a hun ta sih a, anih, hun ruot chu a tlung tah.

en: For thy servants take pleasure in her stones, And have pity upon her dust.
hmr: I siehlawhai chun a lunghai chu an ngainain, A pilvut chen khawm an lunginsiet sih a.

en: So the nations shall fear the name of Jehovah, And all the kings of the earth thy glory.
hmr: Chuongchun, hnam tinin LALPA hming chu ṭîng an ta, Hnuoia lal po pohai chun i ropuina chu ṭî bawk an tih.

en: For Jehovah hath built up Zion; He hath appeared in his glory.
hmr: LALPA chun Zion khuo chu ân ngîr nâwk ta sih a, A ropuinaa inthuomin ân lang tah.

en: He hath regarded the prayer of the destitute, And hath not despised their prayer.
hmr: Pasiehai ṭawngṭâina chu a ngaisak a, An ṭawngṭâina chu a hmusit nawh.

en: This shall be written for the generation to come; And a people which shall be created shall praise Jehovah.
hmr: Chu chu ruolthar la hung um dinghai ta dingin ziek nîng a ta, Hnam siema la hung um ding chun LALPA chu inpâk an tih.

en: For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; From heaven did Jehovah behold the earth;
hmr: Ama chun a hmun inthieng insângtaka inthawkin a zuk thlîr a, LALPA chun vâna inthawk khin hnuoi hi a hmuh a;

en: To hear the sighing of the prisoner; To loose those that are appointed to death;
hmr: Mi intâng inrûm chu ngai ding le, Thi dinga ruothai chu sût dingin.

en: That men may declare the name of Jehovah in Zion, And his praise in Jerusalem;
hmr: Mihaiin LALPA hming chu Zion khuoa le, Ama inpâkna thu chu Jerusalem khuoa an hril theina dingin;

en: When the peoples are gathered together, And the kingdoms, to serve Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA rawngbâwl dinga, Mi tin le ram tin an inkhâwm pha chun.

en: He weakened my strength in the way; He shortened my days.
hmr: Ama chun lam kâra hin ka tha a sukṭhum a, Ka dam sûng hi a suktâwi a.

en: I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days: Thy years are throughout all generations.
hmr: “Aw ka Pathien, ka vânglai nihaia hin mi la hmang naw la, Nanga kumhai chu suon um sûng po po um a tih,” ka tih a.

en: Of old didst thou lay the foundation of the earth; And the heavens are the work of thy hands.
hmr: Leihnuoi innghatsan chu tiena i phûm tah a na, Vânhai khawm i kutsuok an nih.

en: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure; Yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; As a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed:
hmr: Chuonghai chu la bohmang a ta, nang ruok chu um zing i tih. Anih, chuong po pohai chu silfên angin la hlui a ta, Puon angin thleng i ta, hung danglam tâng a tih.

en: But thou art the same, And thy years shall have no end.
hmr: Nang ruok chu i pângngai zing a, I kumhai chun bo ni hrim nei naw ni.

en: The children of thy servants shall continue, And their seed shall be established before thee.
hmr: I siehlawhai nauhai chu um zing an ta, An thlahai chu i hmaah sukdetin um an tih.
